testmasters.name: Complete Blood Count (CBC)
testmasters.description: A complete blood count (CBC) is a blood test used to evaluate your overall health and detect a wide range of disorders.
testmasters.reference_range: Varies based on parameters like WBC, RBC, etc.

testmasters.name: Fasting Blood Sugar (FBS)
testmasters.description: Measures the glucose level in your blood after a period of fasting.
testmasters.test_preparation_instructions: Fast for 8–12 hours before the test.

testmasters.name: Thyroid Function Test (TFT)
testmasters.description: Includes tests for TSH, T3, and T4 to assess thyroid gland function.

testmasters.name: Urine Routine Test
testmasters.description: Analyzes urine for a wide range of disorders such as urinary tract infections and kidney disease.
testmasters.test_preparation_instructions: Collect midstream sample in a sterile container.
testmasters.reference_range: No pus cells, proteins, ketones, etc.

testmasters.name: COVID-19 RT-PCR
testmasters.description: Detects the presence of SARS-CoV-2 virus using RT-PCR technology.
testmasters.test_preparation_instructions: Do not eat, drink, smoke, or chew gum 30 minutes prior to sample collection.

bookmarks.title: Coronavirus News Highlights: India successfully cultures and isolates new strain of novel coronavirus from UK, says ICMR
bookmarks.description: Today is the 284th day since India implemented a nationwide lockdown to help curb the novel coronavirus pandemic. So far, India has recorded more than 1.03 crore confirmed COVID-19 cases, including 1.49 lakh deaths. A total of 99.06 lakh patients have recovered or been discharged, as per the latest data from the Union Health Ministry. India's recovery rate continues to rise and now stands at 96.1 percent. However, there are 2.50 lakh active cases in the country. Globally, more than 8.3 crore people have been infected by the novel coronavirus and 18.2 lakh have died so far. Many countries have granted emergency use authorization for COVID-19 vaccines and have started the process of vaccinating healthcare workers and high-risk groups. India's regulator is expected to grant a similar approval soon.
bookmarks.content: Today is the 284th day since India implemented a nationwide lockdown to help curb the novel coronavirus pandemic. So far, India has recorded more than 1.03 crore confirmed COVID-19 cases, including 1.49 lakh deaths. A total of 99.06 lakh patients have recovered or been discharged, as per the latest data from the Union Health Ministry. India's recovery rate continues to rise and now stands at 96.1 percent. However, there are 2.50 lakh active cases in the country. Globally, more than 8.3 crore people have been infected by the novel coronavirus and 18.2 lakh have died so far. Many countries have granted emergency use authorization for COVID-19 vaccines and have started the process of vaccinating healthcare workers and high-risk groups. India's regulator is expected to grant a similar approval soon.
